title: Understanding the News Cycle
text: When a government policy is announced, it takes time for detailed analyses to be published. Consider where in-depth articles are typically found.

title: Types of Publications
text: Think about the types of publications that provide detailed analyses. Newspapers, academic journals, and reference books are some options.

title: Timeliness of Information
text: Consider which publication is likely to have a detailed analysis ready by the following Monday after a Tuesday announcement.

title: Choosing the Right Source
text: Which source is most likely to have a detailed analysis of the policy by the following Monday?
